pullRequest.title: db id fix
pullRequest.bodyText:
Converted tables to use the sequence generator type where appropriate.  Metadata tables such as authentication type, defined fields, registered descriptors still use identity generation because developers add them.  Other database tables using sequence generation are tables where data is inserted by the user executing rest api calls or tasks to insert items in bulk.
Also added the ability to re-use the test containers since I was trying to reproduce an issue during a fresh install without having to build and deploy containers.

commit.message: test: Make the testcontainers image persistent via variable.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/6.0.0' into ps_db_id_fix
build: Use an explicit version of liquibase.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/6.0.0' into ps_db_id_fix
Fix: Change the id generation to use sequences.
Fix: Update tests to deal with ID generation.
Fix: Use single increment on ids for authentication_type table.
fix: Use identity types for meta-data tables.
build: Update the build number for testing.
fix: Add a component to read data from the database to initialize JPA.
fix: Remove environment variable override.
test: Add logging statements to confirm logic.
fix: Only release changelocks first when upgrading to 6.0.0.
fix: Remove the override environment variable if it exists.
fix: Change init script to be run multiple times without failing.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/6.0.0' into ps_db_id_fix
refactor: Add and remove comments for clarification.

nodes.bodyText: If I recall correctly, we don't want to declare this because we are not maintaining multiple versions of the same java objects. You should be able to turn off the warning and generation of this from your Intellij settings.
Do we perform bulk inserts on this table? We might be able to get away with IDENTITY here.
Do we perform bulk inserts here? I would assume we do for provider_users, but I'm surprised about this one.
This is another table that I'm surprised we perform bulk inserts on.
Nice. I'm glad you recognized the need for this. It took me forever to figure out how to synchronize with hibernate's generation strategy.
I wonder if there's a way to just get the transaction manager or persistence manager and flush at the top level.

commit.message: refactor: Remove serialVersionId based on PR feedback.
refactor: Add '_generator' suffix to sequence name.
refactor: Use Identity generation for additional tables.
